name: hornpipe
content:
hornpipe noun [C]
(INSTRUMENT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a musical instrument consisting of a tube made of wood or bone that you blow into while covering holes with your fingers, and a bell at the end made of an animal's horn: We could hear the notes of a hornpipe in the distance. He fetched his hornpipe and we played some shanties for the old sailors.

hornpipe noun [C]
(DANCE)
a type of dance, originally from Great Britain, that is traditionally performed by sailors to the music of a hornpipe: The Seaside Festival featured performers singing sea shanties and dancing the hornpipe. Traditionally, a hornpipe begins with the sailors coming on deck and dancing a figure-of-eight.

hornpipe noun [C]
(MUSIC)
a piece of music typical of those that are traditionally played on a hornpipe : sailor's hornpipe The second soloist will perform a sailor's hornpipe. She heard him humming a hornpipe under his breath.
